title: RME-Based Lesson Study (LSLC) Professional Development Program for High School Mathematics Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service language teachers to learn professional development methods for high school mathematics teachers, applying an RME-based lesson study model through asynchronous online collaboration in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain lesson design approaches incorporating RME’s five core principles: reality, interaction, mathematizing, student-centeredness, and diversity.
Learners can execute online collaborative processes (plan-act-reflect) with peer teachers based on the LSLC model.
Learners can create and share RME-based instructional materials (situation models, intermediate models, reference models) in smartphone environments.

resources: LSLC (Learning Support for Language Competence) phase-by-phase guidelines
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
